title: FIrefox crashes and freezes frequently
content:
I experience Firefox crashes when doing simple tasks (Youtube, WhatsApp, searching). It happens frequently. I also experience crashes on my system and other software in general (Photoshop, After Effects, Blender).

Here are some crash reports IDs bp-ad13b5a3-98db-4873-82d3-20b3d0250126 bp-b01811eb-4d7a-47cb-af4f-2265b0250126 bp-abb7bdcf-9bb4-4a64-a745-e5a300250126 bp-6bd03510-8242-4311-9c6a-3dcdf0250125 bp-6c7b83c5-cb1f-4f89-b56d-5f4f20250123 bp-c857cf83-a0fd-4cd2-a4e9-e54010250123 bp-551e852c-0d45-43b2-8908-0552c0250123

I have run memtest86, Prime95, Cinebench and Furmark. These tests and benchmarks detected no errors or performance instabilities.

I believe it's systematic issue. I have licensed software and Win 11, 32 GB RAM, i9-14900HX, 4070 RTX, Lenovo.

I set pagefile management to automatic. I tried to clean cache, but nothing works. SFC /scannow doesn't give errors. Setting firefox.exe to firefox1.exe doesn't help. No addons installed.

What is causing the issue?

Help appreciated! Thanks! :)

title: Firefox resetting the signon.remember setting every time I log in
content:
Hi folks

I have a particularly infuriating problem. A few weeks back, Firefox stopped displaying my usernames and passwords whenever I wanted to log into a site. This coincided with my installing BitDefender, although I don't know why.

Through googling I eventually realised I could go into about:config to fix this. signon.rememberSignons displays as false, when I turn it to true it fixes the issue.

But here is the problem I can't solve. Everytime I restart firefox or my PC / Mac (I am using both, with a syncronised account on both windows and MacOS) it sets signon.rememberSignons to false AGAIN. Which means every single time I browse I have to go into about:config and fix this. Maddening.

Please can you help?

title: Issue with PDF Opening in Firefox
content:
Hello Mozilla Support Team,

I have been using Firefox for a long time, and recently I upgraded my Windows system. Before the upgrade, I had set Firefox to open PDFs directly in a PDF Reader other than Firefox’s built-in PDF viewer, and it worked perfectly. However, after the upgrade, Firefox now shows the "Opening when completed" message and opens PDFs slowly, instead of opening them immediately in my chosen PDF Reader.

I have checked the settings, cleared the cache, refreshed Firefox, and even tested with other software, but the issue persists. The settings for handling PDFs are still the same, but they don't seem to work as they used to.

Can you please assist me in resolving this issue? Any help would be much appreciated.

Thank you

title: Issue with Google services (search, reCaptcha, Drive) with Firefox
content:
Hi,

Firefox latest version, windows 10 up to date.

I experience various issues with Google services:

  • reCaptcha doesn't work: the challenge doesn't appear, or if by chance it does, it just runs forever.
  • Opening pages from the Google search page frequently fails. The page just stops loading on a white page. Reloading multiple times, or removing the Google search encapsulation from the url bar, solves the issue.
  • Accessing files on Drive frequently fails.

Evertyhing works fine 1. with any other browser; 2. with Firefox on a another PC.

I've tried, of course, changing all possible security/tracking options, disabling add-ons, &c, to no avail. I've tried to uninstall/reinstall Firefox - I need what is stored in my profile, so I copied back all of my profile files in the new profile folder. Same issue. I've tried using the newly installed default profile - same issue.

As stated, no issue at all with any other web browser. Can you help me diagnose?

Thank you!

title: skyshowtime problema buffer
content:
Error skyshowtime,

Buenos días, Este fallo se produce unicamente usando la plataforma Skyshowtime, con lo que creo que el problema es de ellos, intenté contactarlos y aparte de decirme que cambiara de navegador (cosa que por supuesto no voy a hacer) creo que estaba hablando con alguien que ni sabia de que le estaba hablando y solo leía un guion.

Al visionar una serie/película, al llevar 2-3 capítulos (o media película) comienza a cortarse y dar saltos, hasta que se produce el fallo, estoy casi seguro que es un problema de volcado de buffer.

Con suerte podrán dar con una solución, he buscado como aumentar el buffer de Firefox, pero no lo he encontrado, y como les decía, solo me ocurre con skyshowtime (también uso Disney+, Amazon video, y otras)

Con suerte la comunidad sabrá algo de este tema, porque no muestra un error especifico, tan solo se cierra, como si fuera el antiguo "pantallazo azul"

Un Saludo

title: Disable creating a new tab when Middle clicking on tab bar area
content:
This has been asked before here, but it seems currently there is no solution:

Firefox's default behavior when using the mouse middle-click on an empty area of the tab bar area will create a new tab; I don't want this behavior. How can I disable it?

On the posts I found here, they mention using UserChrome.css, I enabled it and tried, doesn't work. custom styles are enabled but not disabling this feature.

I use DisplayFusion on my multi-monitor setup since years, and middle-clicking a window title bar or Chrome tab bar or Firefox tab bar will move the current window to a second monitor.

Currently with Firefox, middle-clicking the tab bar will move the window to the second monitor AND open a new tab. I use it a lot with YouTube, so when I move a playing video to the second monitor, I get an empty tab with audio in the background.

I recently moved from Chrome to Firefox, but this is driving me crazy.

title: Washed out colours and some whites appearing glitched and pink.
content:
Recently starting having the issue where some whites and the tab icons appear washed out and even glitched out and pink when using my PC. I haven't made any significant changes to my system as far as I recall.

Colours in other browsers and applications are effected. Going to the same webpage on both Brave and Edge shows the whites correctly. On all the games on my PC there are no glitches in colours.

I have tried a few fixes already: -Removing and re-downloading GPU drivers - Fixes the issue temporarily. After about 1 day the issue comes back. -Re-seating the GPU - No fix. -Turning off colour override in Firefox - No fix. -Uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox - No fix.

If anyone has an idea or knows the setting that may be causing this problem I would really appreciate it.
creator: joelhiggins849

title: Annoying Blue Dot Appears Near Input Area in ChatGPT on Firefox
content:
Hello,

I’ve encountered an issue while using ChatGPT on Firefox. A small blue dot appears near the query input area, and it interrupts the typing process. When the dot is active, I cannot type properly because the first keypress is consumed to deactivate the dot instead of being entered into the input field.

For example, if I try to type "Hello," the "h" key is used to deactivate the dot, and only "ello" appears in the input box. This issue forces me to either click on the blue dot or press a key before I can start typing.

The problem is specific to Firefox and does not occur on other browsers like Chrome or Edge. I’ve already tried clearing the cache, disabling extensions, and updating Firefox, but the issue persists.

This behavior is quite frustrating and disrupts the user experience. Could you please look into it?

Thank you,
creator: mahdi.shalchian

title: Fubo TV no longer will play content
content: We're finding we can no longer watch FUBO TV on Firefox. Works fine in Edge. Anyone have any suggestions? We've cleared cache/history, restarted laptop, etc. This occurs both on recorded programs and live tv. We still seem to be able to get the commercials, although we tried watching on two different devices and the commercials were very different. Is it possible for Firefox to have been hacked but not Edge on the same device? Doesn't sound plausible to me, but I'm not sure. This has happened since the last update to Firefox. We have Windows 10 64 bit. Firefox 134.0.2 or whatever the latest version is. We're stumped why it works on one browser but not the other. Has to be a Firefox issue.

title: Cookie Storage Nightmare
content:
Back in November (2024) I began noticing an absorbent number of cookies in “Manage Cookies and Site Data” (MCSD). Considering I delete cookies with fair regularity daily, this is unusual. The amount that I am seeing now, is around 190 advertising/Tracking cookies even when I only visit one or two sites. If I remove them and recycle the page and return to MCSD they are all back in storage in only those few seconds. This process can go on forever. This occurs even when I disconnect from the internet. How is this possible, where are these companies storing this stuff on my computer and how do I remove them and/or stop them from self populating? I have a Dell 64 something, running windows 10 I have Ad Blocker and Privacy Badger, along with a few others that are not security based. See Attachments

Thanks

title: Saved passwords
content: I am having a problem with Firefox losing or not updating some saved passwords. It has always worked seamlessly in the past, but in the past couple of weeks (January 2025), several sites that I regularly visit and have saved passwords for (nothing financial; I never save that stuff) have not auto-populated the password field and I have had to change passwords. I did this on one site a couple of days ago, using my mobile and tablet (both Firefox web browsers), but when I went to log in to that site on my desktop Firefox browser today, it had not updated the password, and even when I typed in the new password, Firefox did not offer - as it normally would - to update the saved password. I was logged in to Firefox at the time, so my account was live. Anyone else having this problem? Or know why it's happening?
